identificationModule.briefTitle: Creation of a Biospecimen Repository From Patients With Interstitial Lung Diseases (ILD)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Creation of a Biospecimen Repository From Patients With Interstitial Lung Diseases (ILD)

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Assistant Professor of Medicine, College of Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To develop a repository of blood samples from patients with ILD to support future studies into the development of such biomarkers. Patients with pneumonia and healthy patients will also be recruited as a control group.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The proposed biospecimen repository would be derived from patients diagnosed with ILD. This is to include 500 patients in the repository, with each patient contributing one blood sample. Patients with pneumonia and healthy patients will also be recruited as a control group.

bioSpec.description:
To develop a repository of blood samples from patients with ILD to support future studies into the development of such biomarkers. Patients with pneumonia and healthy patients will also be recruited as a control group. The repository would be maintained in Dr. Carmona's laboratory in the Thoracic Diseases Research Unit in the Stabile building where all biospecimens will be stored.

These samples will be stored in freezers in Dr. Carmona's laboratory space in the Thoracic Diseases Research Unit in the Stabile building for future research.

armGroups.label: ILD
armGroups.description: 250 patients (male and females \>18 years of age) with the diagnosis of fibrotic DILD (IPF (n=100), fibrotic NSIP (n=50), chronic hypersensitivity pneumonia (n=20), sarcoidosis(n=50), progressive rheumatoid lung disease (n=10) and scleroderma lung disease (n=20), 10 patients with other fibrosing disease (fibrosing mediastinitis), and 50 patients with lymphangioleiomyomatosis.

armGroups.label: Healthy
armGroups.description: 100 healthy participants as a control group.

armGroups.label: Pneumonia
armGroups.description: 25 patients with pneumonia as a control group.

interventions.name: ILD
interventions.description: 100 cc of blood collected from a total of 250 ILD patients. This includes IPF (n=100), fibrotic NSIP (n=50), chronic hypersensitivity pneumonia (n=20), sarcoidosis(n=50), progressive rheumatoid lung disease (n=10) and scleroderma lung disease (n=20)), 10 patients with other fibrosing disease (fibrosing mediastinitis), and 50 patients with lymphangioleiomyomatosis

interventions.name: Healthy
interventions.description: 100 cc of blood collected from a total of 25 healthy volunteers in order to compare with the ILD participants.

interventions.name: Pneumonia
interventions.description: 100 cc of blood collected from a total of 100 participants with a diagnosis of pneumonia in order to compare with the ILD participants.

primaryOutcomes.description: Reliable biomarkers to help guide treatment in ILD would be a major step forward in the management of this disease.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients with a diagnosis of ILD or any fibrotic disease of the lung or a diagnosis of pneumonia
* Patients willing to provide written informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Unwillingness/unable to give blood samples
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients with a diagnosis of ILD or any fibrotic disease of the lung. A diagnosis of pneumonia and healthy volunteers will also be included as a control group.

overallOfficials.name: Eva M Carmona Porquera, MD, PhD

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: IPD will not be shared at this time, but it may be possible that in the future outside institutions or other researchers within the Mayo Clinic may ask for specimen samples. If a specimen sample is requested, a new protocol will be submitted to the IRB or the IRB application for this study will be amended.
